definition: sleep/to sleep/(computing) to enter sleep mode
to be fast asleep/(fig.) to lie dormant/to lie undiscovered

sentences.english: I just need some place where I can lay my head.
sentences.chinese: 只想找個地方我可以倒頭就睡。

sentences.english: Few drinks at the dinner will find us all snoozed at the sofa.
sentences.chinese: 晚飯來幾杯，過會紛紛睡倒在沙發上了。

sentences.english: Sleeping at last in a dreamless sleep locked fast.
sentences.chinese: 終於在無夢的睡眠中睡得香。

sentences.english: If I overslept because I am ill, I always call in absent to work –
sentences.chinese: 如果我睡過頭是因爲我生病了，我總會打電話請假。

sentences.english: They want to live on the road.
sentences.chinese: 他們就想睡在大馬路上。

sentences.english: When I am about to nod off in the office, the boss walked in.
sentences.chinese: 我在辦公室剛剛欲睡，老闆走了進來。

sentences.english: He sleeps in a tent now.
sentences.chinese: 他現在睡在一個帳篷裏。

sentences.english: You eat more and more until you fall asleep.
sentences.chinese: 你就會越喫越多，直到你睡去。

sentences.english: Sky turned to gray, as dark as eyes still awake.
sentences.chinese: 灰色的天，暗如未睡的雙眼。

sentences.english: We ate half a jin of roast chestnuts, had a nap and soon arrived in Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 一路上吃了半斤炒栗子，睡了一會兒覺，就到了北京。

sentences.english: What if she oversleeps and misses the bus?
sentences.chinese: 假如她睡過頭錯過班車怎麼辦？

sentences.english: It has been real resting, for I could consistently sleep until naturally wake up.
sentences.chinese: 真的是休息了，每天都睡到自然醒。

sentences.english: I like to garden , do you like to sleep-in in the mornings or get up early ?
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡到花園，你喜歡睡在早晨或早起？

sentences.english: You can bed down on the settee.
sentences.chinese: 你可以睡在中型沙發上。

sentences.english: School-aged children and teens need at least 9 hours of sleep a day.
sentences.chinese: 學齡童和青少年每天至少睡9小時。

sentences.english: Your baby is now waking and sleeping at regular intervals.
sentences.chinese: 現在，嬰兒會在有規律的間隔內醒來和睡去。

definition: to go to bed/(coll.) to have sex
to make one's bed on the floor
to lie down to sleep with one's clothes on
